meanings.definition: Bushbucks: a type of antelope found in sub-Saharan Africa.
meanings.sent1: The bushbucks grazed peacefully in the grassy savannah.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of bushbucks near the watering hole.
meanings.sent3: The bushbucks played hide and seek among the tall trees.
meanings.sent4: The grace of the bushbucks reminded me of dancers in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The striking horns of the bushbucks made them stand out in the herd.

meanings.definition: Bushbucks: the plural form of bushbuck, referring to multiple individuals of the species.
meanings.sent1: Look at all those bushbucks roaming together in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bushbucks gracefully moved through the dense vegetation.
meanings.sent3: The bushbucks held a meeting to discuss the best grazing spots.
meanings.sent4: The bushbucks stood out from the other antelopes with their unique markings.
meanings.sent5: The bushbucks' agility helped them navigate the rough terrain effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Bushbucks: to refer to the act of hunting or observing bushbucks in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent1: We decided to bushbucks this weekend for our nature photography project.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys bushbucks as a way to connect with nature.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally scared away the bushbucks while trying to take a picture.
meanings.sent4: Bushbucking requires patience and a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent5: The group set out early morning to bushbucks in the national park.
